title: 1990 NCAA Men's Volleyball Tournament
text:
The 1990 <a href="NCAA%20Men%27s%20National%20Collegiate%20Volleyball%20Championship">NCAA Men's Volleyball Tournament</a> was the 21st annual tournament to determine the national champion of <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a> men's collegiate <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a>. The tournament was played at the <a href="Patriot%20Center">Patriot Center</a> in <a href="Fairfax%2C%20Virginia">Fairfax, Virginia</a> during May 1990. 
<a href="USC%20Trojans%20men%27s%20volleyball">USC</a> defeated <a href="Long%20Beach%20State%2049ers%20men%27s%20volleyball">Long Beach State</a> in the final match, 3–1 (15–10, 12–15, 15–4, 15–6), to win their fourth national title. The Trojans (26–7) were coached by <a href="Jim%20McLaughlin%20%28coach%29">Jim McLaughlin</a>.
USC's <a href="Bryan%20Ivie">Bryan Ivie</a> was named the tournament's "Most Outstanding Player". Ivie, along with five other players, comprised the "All-Tournament Team".
Qualification.
Until the creation of the <a href="NCAA%20Men%27s%20Division%20III%20Volleyball%20Championship">NCAA Men's Division III Volleyball Championship</a> in 2012, there was only a single national championship for men's volleyball. As such, all <a href="NCAA">NCAA</a> men's volleyball programs, whether from <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I">Division I</a>, <a href="NCAA%20Division%20II">Division II</a>, or <a href="NCAA%20Division%20III">Division III</a>, were eligible. A total of 4 teams were invited to contest this championship.
